👉 $AAPL : Apple is building a double-bottom base with a 176.75 buy point, Shares are about 10% away from the new buy point after Monday's 2.4% loss. AAPL stock found support at its long-term 200-day line on Feb. 24, but remains below its 50-day moving average.

👉 $MSFT : Software leader Microsoft fell 3.8% Monday, closing further below the 200-day line. Shares continue to build a new base.

👉 $DKS : Dick's Sporting Goods (DKS, $107.93) headlines a busy week of retail earnings. The company is slated on the earnings calendar to report its fourth-quarter results before Tuesday's open Analysts, on average, are forecasting fourth-quarter earnings of $3.43 per share for Dick's Sporting Goods, which is 41.2% more than what the company reported in the year-ago period. Revenue, meanwhile, is expected to arrive at $3.3 billion, +5.4% year-over-year (YoY).

Trade Ideas $MSFT (delayed) MAR25 305C #lotto - still actionable

Oh yeah, and $DBX also has a forward PE of 14.9! They're not the fastest grower, but hey still grow at a rough 10% YoY. Plus, $DBX always beats analyst expectations. 
 
True, $GOOG, $AAPL, $MSFT are a sort of a competitor (and I like them as companies, too), but $DBX has carved out a niche for itself and is focusing heavy on small businesses, gig workers, self-employed people, etc. $DBX even integrates with Google Drive and OneDrive so that should tell you something 
 
Generally speaking, I think $DBX is a low-risk investment right now with a lot more upside than downside. Given the current market conditions, it's a good pick in my books.

@benni124 that buy and hold advice is too broad and is never explained correctly in my opinion - nothing works better than “having your own specific plan” everyone didn’t buy all at the same time, didn’t buy the same assets/securities and don’t have the same average. In my opinion take profit before it turns into a major loss and a sad story - buy and hold works for people who bought well before 2009 and have very low averages in their holdings - if you just bought last year or 2020 there’s a high chance you lost all of your gains already. People say buy and hold very broadly when it should be said “if you got in early enough and have a good average share price in solid investments in great companies like $AAPL $MSFT $GOOG then just hold” not “just buy and and hold you’ll be fine in 30 years” that’s terrible advice….
